category: Sports Fair Committee Regulations/Article 30 (Right to interrogate and make statements)
contents: Article 30 (Right to interrogate and make statements) ① The committee may interrogate the person suspected of disciplinary action regarding the details of the charge, and, if deemed necessary, may request the attendance of the relevant person. ② The committee must give the person suspected of disciplinary action an opportunity to make a sufficient statement, and the person suspected of disciplinary action may state facts or submit evidence that is beneficial to him/her in writing or orally. ③ A person suspected of disciplinary action may request the interrogation of a witness. In this case, the committee must decide whether to adopt it or not. ④ Requesters and applicants for disciplinary decisions may attend the committee or state their opinions in writing when deemed necessary.
